body_html:
@suharshs Thank you! I created a new issue for some gradients that are very useful for building machine learning models here.

Control flow is not absolutely necessary I guess, but it can be very useful for RNNs. However, the gradient implementation is not as simple as registering a gradient for an op. I think it has to be considered while performing back-propagation as a special case (similar to what the Python API does).
body_text:
@suharshs Thank you! I created a new issue for some gradients that are very useful for building machine learning models here.
Control flow is not absolutely necessary I guess, but it can be very useful for RNNs. However, the gradient implementation is not as simple as registering a gradient for an op. I think it has to be considered while performing back-propagation as a special case (similar to what the Python API does).
body:
@suharshs Thank you! I created a new issue for some gradients that are very useful for building machine learning models [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/9645). 

Control flow is not absolutely necessary I guess, but it can be very useful for RNNs. However, the gradient implementation is not as simple as registering a gradient for an op. I think it has to be considered while performing back-propagation as a special case (similar to what the Python API does).
